item.title: Agent-to-Sim: Learning Interactive Behavior Models from Casual Longitudinal Videos
item.description: Agent-to-Sim (ATS) learns interactive 3D agent behaviors from casual longitudinal videos using a novel coarse-to-fine registration and generative modeling approach, enabling real-to-sim transfer for v…

item.title: Alchemy: Amplifying Theorem-Proving Capability through Symbolic Mutation
item.description: Alchemy: A novel framework synthesizes formal theorems via symbolic mutation, boosting neural theorem-proving performance by significantly expanding the training dataset.

item.title: AutoTrain: No-code training for state-of-the-art models
item.description: AutoTrain: a no-code, open-source library simplifies training state-of-the-art models for diverse tasks, democratizing access to advanced AI.

item.title: CompassJudger-1: All-in-one Judge Model Helps Model Evaluation and Evolution
item.description: CompassJudger-1: An open-source, all-in-one judge LLM offering robust generalization and diverse evaluation capabilities, enhanced by the new JudgerBench benchmark, propelling LLM evaluation forward.

item.title: FrugalNeRF: Fast Convergence for Few-shot Novel View Synthesis without Learned Priors
item.description: FrugalNeRF: a novel few-shot NeRF, achieves high-fidelity 3D scene reconstruction with significantly faster convergence, eliminating the need for external data or complex scheduling.

item.title: Pangea: A Fully Open Multilingual Multimodal LLM for 39 Languages
item.description: PANGEA: A fully open multilingual, multimodal LLM for 39 languages, significantly outperforming existing models in diverse cultural contexts.

item.title: Pre-training Distillation for Large Language Models: A Design Space Exploration
item.description: Boosting LLMs: This study reveals how pre-training distillation significantly enhances large language models, exploring key design factors for optimal performance.

item.title: RM-Bench: Benchmarking Reward Models of Language Models with Subtlety and Style
item.description: RM-BENCH: a new benchmark reveals that current reward models struggle with subtle content and style, highlighting the need for improvement and better alignment of language models.

item.title: SAM2Long: Enhancing SAM 2 for Long Video Segmentation with a Training-Free Memory Tree
item.description: SAM2Long enhances video object segmentation by using a training-free memory tree, significantly improving accuracy and handling of occlusions and reappearing objects in long videos.

item.title: Selecting Influential Samples for Long Context Alignment via Homologous Models' Guidance and Contextual Awareness Measurement
item.description: GATEAU, a novel framework, leverages Homologous Models’ Guidance and Contextual Awareness Measurement to identify influential samples for enhanced long-context alignment in LLMs, boosting performance …

item.title: Hallucination Detox: Sensitive Neuron Dropout (SeND) for Large Language Model Training
item.description: New training method, Sensitive Neuron Dropout (SeND), reduces Large Language Model (LLM) hallucinations by up to 40%, improving factual accuracy and reliability.

item.title: Ichigo: Mixed-Modal Early-Fusion Realtime Voice Assistant
item.description: Ichigo, a novel mixed-modal voice assistant, achieves real-time speech understanding and generation by using a tokenized early-fusion approach, significantly outperforming existing methods.

item.title: Baichuan Alignment Technical Report
item.description: Baichuan Alignment unveils novel techniques for aligning LLMs, boosting performance significantly across various benchmarks and user experience metrics, advancing the field towards AGI.

item.title: DM-Codec: Distilling Multimodal Representations for Speech Tokenization
item.description: DM-Codec, a novel speech tokenizer, leverages multimodal distillation to drastically improve speech quality and reduce transcription errors, outperforming state-of-the-art methods.

item.title: How Many Van Goghs Does It Take to Van Gogh? Finding the Imitation Threshold
item.description: Researchers discover the ‘imitation threshold’ in text-to-image models: around 200-600 training images are needed to reliably generate images of a specific person or art style, impacting copyright a…

item.title: CBT-Bench: Evaluating Large Language Models on Assisting Cognitive Behavior Therapy
item.description: CBT-BENCH: A new benchmark systematically evaluates LLMs’ potential for assisting Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), revealing strengths and weaknesses in various CBT tasks.

item.title: Cross-Lingual Auto Evaluation for Assessing Multilingual LLMs
item.description: The CIA Suite, a novel extensible framework, enables cross-lingual evaluation of multilingual LLMs using evaluator LLMs and a new multilingual benchmark dataset.

item.title: In-context learning and Occam's razor
item.description: This study reveals that in-context learning implicitly minimizes model complexity alongside training error, providing a theoretical basis for Occam’s Razor in modern sequence models.

item.title: PUMA: Empowering Unified MLLM with Multi-granular Visual Generation
item.description: PUMA: a unified multi-granular MLLM mastering diverse visual tasks by seamlessly integrating image generation and understanding, achieving both high diversity and precise controllability.

item.title: Router-Tuning: A Simple and Effective Approach for Enabling Dynamic-Depth in Transformers
item.description: Router-Tuning and MindSkip boost Transformer efficiency by dynamically skipping less crucial layers, achieving a 21% speedup with minimal performance loss.

item.title: SemiEvol: Semi-supervised Fine-tuning for LLM Adaptation
item.description: SEMIEVOL: A novel semi-supervised fine-tuning framework boosts LLM performance by cleverly integrating labeled and unlabeled data via knowledge propagation and adaptive selection, enabling efficient m…

item.title: Meta-Chunking: Learning Efficient Text Segmentation via Logical Perception
item.description: Meta-Chunking: A novel text segmentation method using LLMs improves RAG efficiency by 1.32 on 2WikiMultihopQA, consuming only 45.8% of the time compared to similarity chunking.
